org.eclipse.californium.core.coap

Class MessageObserverAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.californium.core.coap.MessageObserverAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageObserver

    public abstract class MessageObserverAdapter
extends Object
implements MessageObserver
    An abstract adapter class for reacting to a message's lifecylce events.

    The methods in this class are empty, except onReject(), onTimeout(), and onSendError(Throwable), which are calling failed() as default implementation. This class exists as convenience for creating message observer objects.

    Subclasses should override the methods for the events of interest.

    An instance of the concrete message observer can then be registered with a message using the message's addMessageObserver method.

      • onTimeout

        public void onTimeout()
        Description copied from interface: MessageObserver
        Invoked when the client stops retransmitting the message and still has not received anything from the remote endpoint.

        By default this is the case after 5 unsuccessful transmission attempts.

        Specified by:
        onTimeout in interface MessageObserver

        Description copied from interface: MessageObserver

        Specified by:

      • onContextEstablished

        public void onContextEstablished(org.eclipse.californium.elements.EndpointContext endpointContext)
        Description copied from interface: MessageObserver
        Invoked when the resulting endpoint context is reported by the connector. Note: usually this callback must be processed in a synchronous manner, because if it returns, the message is sent. Therefore take special care in methods called on this callback.
        Specified by:
        onContextEstablished in interface MessageObserver
        Parameters:
        endpointContext - resulting endpoint context
